page.title: 19Traffic in Gt. Yeldham
page.content: The A.604 road, which passes through Gt.Yeldham,connects the industrial Midlands to the East Coast ports of Harwich and Felixstowe.It is therefore a relatively busy route, certainly the principal road in this block.A recent traffic survey undertaken on a weekday morning revealed an hourly flow of 214 vehicles,about one-third of which were commercial vehicles.A 40 m.p.h. speed limit operates through the village which we felt was reasonable because visibility is quite good but we believe that this limit is often ignored, especially along the hill near Gt.Yeldham School.This is a cause of concern to the staff of the School. The road has been subject to surface water flooding and improvements are now in hand to remedy this.These works cause traffic delays at busy times.
